group_works.title: Communicating with a group
group_works.creator_credit: John Krish and Rank Audio Visual

results.title: Communicating with a group
results.creator_credit: John Krish and Rank Audio Visual
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Manager in Action”.
This film takes the form of a dramatised in-company training session on group communication. The film is designed to improve the abilities of people to communicate effectively with all groups. The special problems of communication with groups are identified.

results.title: How to make the organization work for you
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, Ameron and BNA Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
Rules, procedures and good manners are essential, but flexibility is needed. No organisation can operate solely “by the book”. Accomplishment should be the aim, not solely promotion. Outside interests should be developed as a buffer against possible disappointments in the later stages of one’s career. Narrated by Peter Drucker.
results.title_for_label: How to make the organization work for you
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pare Lorentz Jr, Ameron and BNA Communications

results.title: How to take the right risks: the manager as decision maker
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, Ameron and BNA Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
All decisions involve an element of risk. The issues must be carefully defined and all alternatives considered. Also if it is not an isolated incident, it is desirable to establish a policy for dealing with similar situations. Narrated by Peter Drucker.
results.title_for_label: How to take the right risks: the manager as decision maker
results.creator_credit_for_label: Pare Lorentz Jr, Ameron and BNA Communications

results.title: How to work with your fellow managers
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr and BNA Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
Peter Drucker hosts this film which shows how friction, lack of understanding and poor teamwork among managers is largely a matter of poor relationships, rather than poor communication. Managers do not try to understand the different objectives of each section.

results.title: How to manage the boss
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, Ameron and BNA Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
The subordinate must be able to “read” the boss, to be able to communicate, to prevent “surprises” - problems and crises that could have been anticipated. Bosses need support from the staff, which if given will augment personal effectiveness. Narrated by Peter Drucker.

results.title: Planning and goal setting: time waste or management tool
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz Jr, Fred H Joiner, Ameron and BNA Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
Explores the advantages and disadvantages of economic forecasts and business plans, various practicalities and difficulties to overcome and how to overcome them. Also considers the costs and benefits of planning yourself, or out-sourcing professional planners.

results.title: Helping people perform: what managers are paid for
results.creator_credit: Pare Lorentz, Fred H Joiner and BNA Communications
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Manager and the Organization”.
Discusses three aspects of management: appraisal and development; performance standards and self-control; and motivation.
